channel.title: I need some help with a few things
channel.description: 1. my jail/unjail dosent work 100%. i can jail someone but they can type ::home and tele away or other :: commands and sometimes its disconnects me 2.if anyone could tell me the ID of a working wall or explain tom he how to make it so you can pass thro an object or make it like a wall 3.i have a clean client and there is no models folder, to add new models do i just add a new folder or? what?

item.title: I need some help with a few things
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“lilmanx, post:1, topic:451797”]1. my jail/unjail dosent work 100%. i can jail someone but they can type ::home and tele away or other :: commands and sometimes its disconnects me
2.if anyone could tell me the ID of a working wall or explain tom he how to make it so you can pass thro an object or make it like a wall
3.i have a clean client and there is no models folder, to add new models do i just add a new folder or? what?[/quote]

Add a check to your home command i.e:

if(c.isInJail()) { //check if the player is in jail sendMessage(""); //message contents here return; //return the function }

As for your second question, noclipping through objects is client/sided. They’re done via input strings, you can google a tutorial on that, and same for the models :).

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help with a few things

well its set 2 but i did all the other steps

item.title: I need some help with a few things
item.dc:creator: @joelandjacob joelandjacob
item.description:
@joelandjacob wrote:

  1. http://lmgtfy.com/?q=project+insanity+jail+command
  2. You must go into your ObjectManager.java and add the walls yourself. Code can be found on the runelocus object id list tool.
  3. Just create a models folder, add your files in there, put them in your item.cfg, and ta-dah!

Read full topic
